ul.li1: 1“The sin of Judah is written with an iron stylus,
ul.li2: with a point of diamond it is engraved
ul.li1: on the tablet of their heart,
ul.li2: and on the horns of their altars.
ul.li1: 2As the remembering of their children,
ul.li2: so is the remembering of their altars
ul.li1: and their poles of Asherah worship
ul.li2: beside the leafy treesHebrew “tree” on the high hills.
ul.li1: 3O my mountain in the open country,
ul.li2: I will give your wealth, all your treasures, for spoil,
ul.li1: your high places, because of your sin,
ul.li2: throughout all your territories.
ul.li1: 4And you will let go your hand from your inheritanceLiterally “you shall loose and in you from your inheritance”
ul.li2: that I gave to you,
ul.li1: and I will make you serve your enemies
ul.li2: in the land that you do not know,
ul.li1: for you kindled a fire in my anger,
ul.li2: until eternity it will be kindled.”

chapter.pericope: The One Who Trusts in Humankind Contrasted With the One Who Trusts in Yahweh

ul.li1: “Cursed is the person who trusts in humankind
ul.li2: and makes flesh his strength,Literally “arm”
and turns aside his heart from Yahweh.
ul.li1: 6And he will be like a juniper in the wilderness,Or “Arabah”
ul.li2: and he will not see when good comes,
ul.li1: and he will dwell in the parched places in the desert,Or “wilderness”
ul.li2: in a land of salt flats,Hebrew “salt flat” where no one lives.
ul.li1: 7Blessed be the person who trusts in Yahweh,
ul.li2: and Yahweh is his trust.
ul.li1: 8For he will be like a tree planted by water,
ul.li2: and to the stream it sends its roots,
ul.li1: and it will not fear when heat comes,
ul.li2: and its leavesHebrew “leaf” will be luxuriant,
ul.li1: and in the year of drought it will not be anxious,
ul.li2: and it will not cease from the bearing of fruit.
ul.li1: 9The heart is deceitful more than anything else,
ul.li2: and it is disastrous. Who can understand it?
ul.li1: 10I, Yahweh, examine the mind,Literally “heart”
ul.li2: I test the heart,Literally “kidneys”
ul.li1: and give to each one according to his way,
ul.li2: according to the fruit of his deeds.
ul.li1: 11Like a partridge that hatches eggs it did not lay
ul.li2: is one who amasses wealth without justice.
ul.li1: In the middle of his days it will leave him,
ul.li2: and at his end he will prove to be a fool.”

ul.li1: 12A lofty throne of glory from the beginning
ul.li2: is the place of our sanctuary.
ul.li1: 13O Yahweh, the hope of Israel,
ul.li2: all those who forsake you will be put to shame,
ul.li1: and those who turn aside from you in the earth will be recorded,
ul.li2: for they have forsaken the fountain of living water, Yahweh.
ul.li1: 14Heal me, O Yahweh, and I will be healed,
ul.li2: save me, and I will be saved,
for you are my praise.
ul.li1: 15Look, they are saying to me,
ul.li2: “Where is the word of Yahweh?
Please let it come.”
ul.li1: 16But I, I have not run away from being a shepherd who follows you,Literally “after you”
ul.li2: and I have not desired the disastrous day.
ul.li1: You, you know the pronouncement of my lips,
ul.li2: it was before your face.
ul.li1: 17You must not become to me a terror,
ul.li2: you are my refuge in the day of disaster.
ul.li1: 18Let my persecutors be put to shame,
ul.li2: but as for me,Literally “I” do not let me be put to shame.
ul.li1: Let them be dismayed,
ul.li2: but as for me,Literally “I” do not let me be dismayed.
ul.li1: Bring on them the day of disaster,
ul.li2: and with double destruction, destroy them.

chapter.p: 19Thus said Yahweh to me, “Go, and you must stand in the People’s GateLiterally “gate of the sons/children of the people” through which the kings of Judah enter, and through which they go out, and in all the gates of Jerusalem. 20And you must say to them, ‘Hear the word of Yahweh, kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem who enter through these gates. 21Thus says Yahweh, “Be on your guard for the sake of yourselves, that you must not carry a burden on the day of the Sabbath, and you must not bring itHere the direct object is supplied from context in the English translation through the gates of Jerusalem. 22And you must not carry a burden from your houses on the day of the Sabbath, and you must not do any work. But you must declare holy the day of Sabbath, just as I commanded your ancestors.Or “fathers” 23Yet they did not listen, and they did not incline their ear, and they hardened their neck so as to not hear, nor to receive discipline.

24“And it will happen, if you carefully listen to me,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh, “to bring no burden through the gates of this city on the day of the Sabbath, but to declare holy the day of Sabbath, not to do on it any work, 25then kings and officials who sit on the throne of David will enter through the gates of this city riding in chariotsHebrew “chariot” and on horses, they, and their officials, the people of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and this city will be inhabited forever.Literally “to eternity” 26And they will come from the towns of Judah, and from all around Jerusalem, and from the land of Benjamin, and from the Shephelah, and from the hill country, and from the Negev, bringing burnt offerings,Hebrew “burnt offering” and sacrifices,Hebrew “sacrifice” and grain offerings,Hebrew “grain offering” and frankincense, and bringing thank offeringsHebrew “thank offering” to the house of Yahweh. 27But if you do not listen to me, to declare holy the day of the Sabbath, and to not carry a burden and enter through the gates of Jerusalem on the day of the Sabbath, then I will kindle a fire in its gates, and it will devour the palaces of Jerusalem, and it will not be quenched.” ’ ”
